task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block and the target outline, approach and align the circular tool, then execute incremental pushes (leftward then upward) to seat the block onto the target, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a red, T-shaped block onto a T-shaped target outline on a white tabletop. The behavior emphasizes perception of both the movable block and the target, a gentle approach, yaw alignment of the tool, and two staged push directions to translate and fine-position the block. Observations suggest initial approach from the right/top, contact near the block’s stem, then progressive pushing with small distances. Timing budgets use 400–1500 ms bins and short repeats to converge.
preconditions: Workspace clear with block and target visible
Robot reachable to the block and target area
End-effector free of contact at start
stepwise_plan: Perceive the T block and target outline.
Move above the block and align precisely for pushing.
Yaw the tool to push left; execute short repeated pushes.
Re-align, yaw to push upward; execute short repeated pushes.
Retreat and wait briefly for stabilization.
success_criteria: Block lies within the target outline after pushes
No object topple or loss of contact during transfer
failure_and_recovery: If misalignment occurs: re-run ApproachAndAlign before pushing.
If motion insufficient: additional Push repeats.
If contact unstable: retreat slightly and re-approach.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful placement check or after final retreat and stabilization wait.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Pre-grasp approach above the block for safe contact.
Orient tool to push leftward along x.
Orient tool to push upward along y.
Fine upward pushes for final seating.
Back off from the object and clear the workspace.

failure_modes: Object not detected or partially occluded
recovery_strategy: Retreat and retry with smaller distances
assumptions: Target appears blue in frames rather than green as stated; treated as 'target_T' outline.
End-effector is cylindrical/round; pushing not grasping.
Exact goal tolerance not provided; we use 0.01 as precise alignment.

expected_success_criteria: Block centroid overlaps target outline and remains after retreat
